javadoc:
NOTE:  ALL FIELDFACTORY CLASSES MUST END IN "FieldFactory".  If not,
 the ClassSearcher will not find them.

 Base class for Field Factories.

methods.name: <init>
methods.comment: Base constructor

params.name: name
params.comment: the name of the field

params.name: model
params.comment: the model that the field belongs to.

params.name: highlightProvider
params.comment: the HightLightStringProvider.

params.name: displayOptions
params.comment: the Options for display properties.

params.name: fieldOptions
params.comment: the Options for field specific properties.

methods.javadoc:
Constructs a FieldFactory with given name.  Used only as potential field.
@param name the name of the field.
methods.name: <init>
methods.comment: Constructs a FieldFactory with given name.  Used only as potential field.

params.name: name
params.comment: the name of the field.

methods.name: optionsChanged
methods.comment: Notification that the Options have changed.

params.name: options
params.comment:
the Options object that changed. Will be either the display
 options or the field options.

params.name: optionName
params.comment: the name of the property that changed.

params.name: oldValue
params.comment: the old value of the property.

params.name: newValue
params.comment: the new value of the property.

methods.javadoc:
Notification the services changed. Subclasses should override this method
 if they care about service changes.
methods.name: servicesChanged
methods.comment:
Notification the services changed. Subclasses should override this method
 if they care about service changes.

methods.name: newInstance
methods.comment:
Returns a new instance of this FieldFactory that can be used to generate fields
 instead of being used as a prototype.

params.name: formatModel
params.comment: the model that the field belongs to.

params.name: highlightProvider
params.comment: the HightLightProvider.

params.name: options
params.comment: the Options for display properties.

params.name: fieldOptions
params.comment: the Options for field specific properties.

methods.name: displayOptionsChanged
methods.comment: Notifications that the display options changed.

params.name: options
params.comment: the Display Options object that changed.

params.name: optionName
params.comment: the name of the property that changed.

params.name: oldValue
params.comment: the old value of the property.

params.name: newValue
params.comment: the new value of the property.

methods.name: fieldOptionsChanged
methods.comment: Notifications that the field options changed.

params.name: options
params.comment: the Field Options object that changed.

params.name: optionName
params.comment: the name of the property that changed.

params.name: oldValue
params.comment: the old value of the property.

params.name: newValue
params.comment: the new value of the property.

methods.javadoc: Returns the Field name.
methods.name: getFieldName
methods.comment: Returns the Field name.

methods.javadoc: Returns the default field color.
methods.name: getDefaultColor
methods.comment: Returns the default field color.

methods.javadoc:
Returns the starting x position for the fields generated by this
 factory.
methods.name: getStartX
methods.comment:
Returns the starting x position for the fields generated by this
 factory.

methods.javadoc: Sets the starting x position for the fields generated by this factory.
methods.name: setStartX
methods.comment: Sets the starting x position for the fields generated by this factory.

methods.javadoc: Returns the width of the fields generated by this factory.
methods.name: getWidth
methods.comment: Returns the width of the fields generated by this factory.

methods.javadoc: Sets the width of the fields generated by this factory.
methods.name: setWidth
methods.comment: Sets the width of the fields generated by this factory.

methods.javadoc: Returns the FieldModel that this factory belongs to.
methods.name: getFieldModel
methods.comment: Returns the FieldModel that this factory belongs to.

methods.javadoc: Returns true if this FieldFactory is currently enabled to generate Fields.
methods.name: isEnabled
methods.comment: Returns true if this FieldFactory is currently enabled to generate Fields.

methods.javadoc:
Turns on or off the generating of Fields by this FieldFactory.
@param state if true, this factory will generate fields.
methods.name: setEnabled
methods.comment: Turns on or off the generating of Fields by this FieldFactory.

params.name: state
params.comment: if true, this factory will generate fields.

methods.name: getField
methods.comment: Generates a Field based on the given information.

params.name: obj
params.comment: The object that the generated field will report some information about.

params.name: varWidth
params.comment: the additional distance along the x axis to place the generated field.

return.comment:
the newly generated FactoryField that shows some property or information about
 the given object.

methods.name: getFieldLocation
methods.comment:
Return a FieldLocation that corresponds to the given index, fieldNum, and ProgramLocation
 IF and ONLY IF the given programLocation is the type generated by this class's
 #getFieldLocation(ListingField, BigInteger, int, ProgramLocation).  Each FieldFactory
 should generate and process a unique ProgramLocation class.

params.name: bf
params.comment: the ListingField at the current cursor.

params.name: index
params.comment: the line index (corresponds to an address)

params.name: fieldNum
params.comment: the index of field within the layout to try and get a FieldLocation.

params.name: loc
params.comment: the ProgramLocation to be converted into a FieldLocation.

methods.name: getProgramLocation
methods.comment: Returns the Program location for the given object, row, col, and groupPath

params.name: row
params.comment: the row within this field

params.name: col
params.comment: the col on the given row within this field.

params.name: bf
params.comment: the ListingField containing the cursor.

methods.name: acceptsType
methods.comment: Used to specify which format models this field can belong to.

params.name: category
params.comment: the category for this field

params.name: proxyObjectClass
params.comment: the type of proxy object used by this field

return.comment: true if this class accepts the given category.

methods.javadoc: Returns a description of the fields generated by this factory.
methods.name: getFieldText
methods.comment: Returns a description of the fields generated by this factory.

methods.javadoc: Returns the font metrics used by this field factory
methods.name: getMetrics
methods.comment: Returns the font metrics used by this field factory

methods.javadoc: @return Returns the metrics.
methods.name: getMetrics

name: FieldFactory
comment:
NOTE:  ALL FIELDFACTORY CLASSES MUST END IN "FieldFactory".  If not,
 the ClassSearcher will not find them.

 Base class for Field Factories.
